Foundational Statistics.description: What are the core principles of foundational statistics?
Explain the difference between a population and a sample in statistics.
Foundational Statistics.solution: Population is the entire group, sample is a subset.

Foundational Statistics.description:
A dataset represents the daily number of customers at a small shop over a week:
45, 50, 55, 60, 65, 70, 7545, 50, 55, 60, 65, 70, 75.
Calculate the mean and standard deviation of this dataset.

A dataset represents the daily number of customers at a small shop over a week:
45, 50, 55, 60, 65, 70, 7545, 50, 55, 60, 65, 70, 75. Calculate the mean and standard deviation of this dataset.

Compute Event Probabilities.description: Calculate the probability of rolling a 7 with two standard six-sided dice.
Compute Event Probabilities.summary: Chance of rolling a 7 with two dice

Compute Event Probabilities.description: What is conditional probability? Provide an example.

Work with Distributions.description: Describe the key characteristics of a normal distribution.
Work with Distributions.summary: Main features of a normal distribution

Work with Distributions.description: When would you use a binomial distribution?
Work with Distributions.solution: Fixed number of trials, two outcomes

Estimate Population Parameters.description: What is a point estimate for a population mean?
Estimate Population Parameters.summary: Defining a point estimate for population mean

Estimate Population Parameters.description: Why are interval estimates often preferred over point estimates?
Estimate Population Parameters.summary: Advantages of interval estimates over point estimates
Estimate Population Parameters.solution: Provide a range of plausible values and confidence level

Compute Confidence Intervals.description: How do you interpret a 95% confidence interval?
Compute Confidence Intervals.solution: 95% confident the true parameter lies within the interval

Compute Confidence Intervals.description: What factors affect the width of a confidence interval?
Compute Confidence Intervals.solution: Sample size, confidence level, standard deviation

Understand Hypothesis Testing.description: Define the null and alternative hypotheses.
What is a p-value and how is it used in hypothesis testing?
Understand Hypothesis Testing.summary: P-value definition and its role in testing
Understand Hypothesis Testing.solution: Probability of observing data if H0 is true

Conduct t-tests.description: When is a one-sample t-test appropriate?
Conduct t-tests.summary: Suitable situations for a one-sample t-test
Conduct t-tests.solution: Comparing sample mean to a known population mean (sigma unknown)

Conduct t-tests.description: What are the assumptions for an independent samples t-test?

Choose Appropriate Test.description: Given two independent groups and continuous data, what test would you use to compare means?
Choose Appropriate Test.summary: Test for comparing means of two independent groups
Choose Appropriate Test.solution: Independent samples t-test (or Welch's if variances unequal)

Choose Appropriate Test.description: If you are comparing proportions of a categorical variable across three groups, what test is suitable?
Choose Appropriate Test.summary: Test for comparing proportions across three groups

Conduct chi-square tests.description: What is the purpose of a chi-square goodness-of-fit test?
Conduct chi-square tests.solution: Compare observed frequencies to expected frequencies

Conduct chi-square tests.description: What does a significant chi-square test of independence indicate?
Conduct chi-square tests.summary: Meaning of significant chi-square independence test
Conduct chi-square tests.solution: There is an association between the two categorical variables

Compute Correlation Coefficients.description: What does a Pearson correlation coefficient of -0.8 indicate?
When would you use Spearman's rank correlation instead of Pearson's?
Compute Correlation Coefficients.summary: When to use Spearman's over Pearson's correlation
Compute Correlation Coefficients.solution: Ordinal data or non-linear monotonic relationship

Correlation vs. Causation.description: Explain why correlation does not imply causation.
Provide an example of a spurious correlation.
Correlation vs. Causation.solution: Ice cream sales and crime rates (both affected by weather)

Perform Linear Regression.description: What is the equation for a simple linear regression model?
Perform Linear Regression.summary: Equation of a simple linear regression

Perform Linear Regression.description: What are the assumptions of linear regression?
Perform Linear Regression.solution: Linearity, independence of errors, homoscedasticity, normality of errors

Interpret Regression Output.description: How do you interpret the slope coefficient in a linear regression model?
Interpret Regression Output.summary: Meaning of slope in linear regression
Interpret Regression Output.solution: Change in Y for a one-unit change in X

Interpret Regression Output.description: What does an R-squared value of 0.75 mean?
Interpret Regression Output.solution: 75% of the variance in Y is explained by X

Understand Spatial Distributions.description: What are the three main types of spatial patterns?
Why is understanding spatial distribution important in geography?
Understand Spatial Distributions.summary: Importance of spatial distribution in geography

Calculate Spatial Central Tendency.description: Name two measures of spatial central tendency.
Calculate Spatial Central Tendency.summary: Two measures for spatial central tendency

Calculate Spatial Central Tendency.description: When might the median center be preferred over the mean center?
Calculate Spatial Central Tendency.summary: When to prefer median center over mean center

Apply Spatial Dispersion Measures.description: What does standard distance deviation measure?
Apply Spatial Dispersion Measures.solution: Absolute dispersion of points around the mean center

Apply Spatial Dispersion Measures.description: How can relative dispersion be assessed in spatial analysis?
Apply Spatial Dispersion Measures.summary: Assessing relative dispersion in spatial analysis
Apply Spatial Dispersion Measures.solution: Comparing standard distance to the size of the study area

Interpret Spatial Coefficients.description: A positive and significant Moran's I value indicates what type of spatial pattern?
Interpret Spatial Coefficients.summary: Spatial pattern from positive Moran's I
